It took such restraint not to buy everything the shop has to offer. I went in on a Saturday and there was a sommelier offering wine tastings, something you don't see much in Madison. I loved her explanation of the wine and even ended up purchasing a bottle, as well as the cheese she recommended pairing it with.  I also highly recommend trying the sandwiches, the Vegiletta is delicious, though I do wish they heated them up instead of serving them cold.

amazing products.  They have the best cheese I've ever tasted.  The staff is super friendly.  They have bite size pieces to full wheels of cheese you could buy.  Also, they have wine connoisseurs, which helped for our cheese & wine party.

Unbelievable cheese and gourmet food store on the capital square next to Inn on the Park hotel.  The staff is very helpful in this place and really knows their cheese.  They often have little samples available to taste or ask them to taste any of the cheeses in their cases.  They also sell lots of other stuff like jams, honey, crackers, nuts and more.  You can also buy cheese related gifts, knives, plates and other cute little items. While not the biggest store, Fromagination is someplace special and definitely worth a visit.

I can't imagine giving Fromagination any less than 5 stars because this is how a business should be run and operated in Madison and anywhere else.  Fromagination is amazing for a lot of reasons, but to put it succinctly and bluntly: the only deficit this place has is a lack of seating for customers. That's it. No, really! (OK, it's a little pricey--but you pay for what you get here.)  The business has incredibly knowledgeable, helpful, friendly and mild-mannered staff that are willing and able to help you out without being pushy or ostensibly arrogant about it. Their cheeses are fantastic, but the sandwiches.  Oh. My. God. I went to Jamba Juice shortly after to get something to drink and I just had to try it there. I left because I was getting stared at for making so many noises about how damn good my chicken sandwich was!--if you had one, you'd be making them too! Fresh French artisan bread with good chicken and fresh lettuce? With what I believe is a fontina cheese? SOLD!  I also want to give them special props to selling other local Madison businesses like Gail Ambrosius; I was so tempted to get something else, but I'll just have to make that my excuse for coming in again!

Friendly and informative, a great place to stop in and grab a bite or just try some cheese.  Eat your way through a bunch of different varieties, talk to the staff and have a good time with it.  I really wish they did a grilled cheese- they must; did I miss it?  Also, there's a little area in the back of the store with food-related trinkets, it's unnecessary and makes the space feel a little cluttered.

Fromagination - you know the second you walk in the door that you have arrived at the Shangri-La of Cheddar, the Nirvana of Neufchatel, the Promised Land of Parmesan and at Blue Cheese Bliss! Definitely an artisan shop located right in the heart of Madison that offers so much more than just cheese and was where we decided to grab a sandwich (and also some cheese to satisfy my need to explore different varieties of blue cheese).  Their sandwiches are pre-made and I was told are made fresh every morning. To be entirely honest, I wasn't exactly thrilled about this. My instant reaction was "So, you're selling gas station sandwiches here?" and "I expect more from a shop like this!". Fairly pricey sandwiches for what is provided which is the only reason I can't give 5 stars. I get it that this is a Capitol Square retail location and rents are much higher compared to a lot of comparable locations. Even with that reasoning, the prices are not justified here... Maybe I am missing something (other than the cost of real estate) but my $8.50 sandwich was pretty much the same thing I can get at Hy-Vee for $6.00.  Was the sandwich good? Yes, it was. I had The Best of the Midwest which included salami, provolone and an olive tapenade. The bread was really good and was probably the highlight of the sandwich. If there was just "a little more" to it, I think this sandwich could be a winner and have a justified price tag.  Moving on to the cheese selections - there are a ton! Extremely good selection and a lot of emphasis on customer service and overall customer experience. I chose to blindly order a blue cheese I have not had before and it didn't fail to deliver on taste. My only problem you ask? Again, the price tag. At almost $30.00/lb I expected to have something that made me drool after entering into a blue cheese coma. Instead, I felt like there may be someone in the back room laughing when they watch a customer pay...  I think Fromagination is a great place that brings something to the area that no other store or retail location can. It's a Wisconsin and Midwest store that delivers on sight, sound, smell and taste. It's a good spot for a sandwich (even though it is pre-made) and a great spot to maybe "try" some smaller portions of cheese to see what you like. Prior to visiting, make sure your wallet is pre-loaded with cash or your credit card has a high available limit. Even though you may not end up buying a lot, whatever you decide to buy will cost more than expected.

The smell when you walk in the door is worth the visit. The store has a great selection and friendly service. I was able to buy cheese curds to bring home.   I would recommend this shop to foodies and anyone who loves cheese. They have meets and other fun goods available too.

There are just some places that I walk into and I feel like I'm in my happy place, a little giddy, and at peace. This list includes bookstores, tiny cocktail lounges, and Fromagination. The employees are always so helpful. There are usually cheese samples. Delicious sandwiches to be bought during lunch time. Also an awesome place to come if you are looking for a great gift. Whether that be a unique jams, fancy chocolates, condiments, specialty beer or liquor they got it here. How do they cram so much into this small store?  One of my favorite reasons to come here is that they have Jeni's Ice Cream. My favorite ice cream on the planet. And not only do they have Jeni's pints, which I know can be found at some other grocery stores, but they have Jeni's ice cream sandwiches! Yum!  If I'm ever around the capitol I love peeking in here, breathe in the smell of tons of cheeses mingling (sorry sounds weird) and treat myself to something fun whether that be trying a new cheese, getting an ice cream sandwich, or finding what is new in stock.  The only thing that brings this place down a star for me is that I find that some things are a little overpriced. I've noted a couple of things that I recall seeing sold at cheaper prices at other local shops.   However the experience of this place is 5 stars for me!

When traveling through Wisconsin, Madison and this particular shop were on the list because of the Yelp reviews. It's interesting how the reviews for Fromagination would split between rave and 'meh'. I have to go with the latter.  The shop is cute as any posh little shop could be, but definitely overpriced when it comes to their cheese selection. In that variety of everything and nothing, I ended up leaving to my next destination, and leaving a few hundred dollars at Brennan's Market.

A house of cheesy wonders.  Well-located and not afraid to offer samples.  We raided the basket of lonely cheese chunks - odds and ends for sale.  The staff arranged them in a cute little box.  It made a great gift for our petsitter.

When I die, may I be reincarnated as a cheesemongerer and work/eat/live at Fromagination?   Literally, the best cheese I have ever consumed. I got to eat three cheeses and drink a glass of wine while sitting outside and looking at the capital building.   I will order gifts for the rents from here and will indulge prob once more before my return to SF. If I am ever back in Madison- I will return mos def!

Really cute little shop packed with a huge variety of products.  The employees were very helpful and allowed us to sample many cheese, and also suggested many different cheese to try based on our preferences.  They also really took their time with each individual customer making sure their questions were answered.  So many fun products jammed in this tiny little shop, I'd definitely check it out!

I don't think I've actually bought a hunk of cheese from here, but I can speak about their sandwiches! They don't make them on Sundays, and there's some sort of limited availability on Saturdays, but they are a great deal. Very reasonably priced (I think around $5), good, chewy bread (the kind I like), and quality insides. They are perfect for a nice spring or summer lunch out on the square or by the lakes.

My parents and I visited here while I was preparing to move to the area.  We ordered sandwiches and also purchased about 15 of the "orphaned" cheese corners so we could try a variety.  We ended up spending about $65 and were disappointed.  My sandwich was the best of all of the sandwiches according to my parents and it was merely decent.  My mom's sandwich looked like wonder bread, a couple of slices of green apple, and deli meat/cheese.  The orphaned cheeses were the biggest disappointment - several of the cheeses were hard and appeared dried out (they were dark yellow and crumbly) - I'd love to say that was they way they were supposed to be except that we had gotten a couple of repeats and one orphan would be soft and white with wonderful flavor and the other would be as described above with a bit of a rancid taste.  None of the orphans had expiration dates on them so we couldnt have known they were bad before we unwrapped them.  The only cheese of the bunch that I would purchase again was the gouda with pimiento and garlic.  Only a few of the cheeses were actually awful but it could have been so much better.  I might try getting cheese from the cheese case in the future but definitely wont purchase orphan cheeses again.

oh fromagination... aka cheese heaven. i love you so.  this is definitely one of those places where it's easy to drop a lot of money, so proceed with caution. you will try delicious cheeses, spreads and crackers from wisconsin and abroad. you will ogle elegant and useful kitchen gadgets. and you will probably leave with a bag full of all these things.  i really love the cheese orphan basket near the register. it's a great way to try a new cheese without spending a lot. the staff is always very friendly and helpful. it can get crowded due to the prime location on the square, so it's best to avoid during farmer's markets, etc.

I really wasn't very happy about my experience at Fromagination today.  As many others have mentioned, this is a very nice store with a great selection of wonderful cheeses.  And, as others have mentioned, these cheeses are quite expensive.  I don't have a problem with paying a premium for shopping at a speciality store, but I expect service that is commensurate with the price that is being charged.  That didn't happen.  I went in today (Sunday) at around three in the afternoon, an hour before closing.  There were several other customers in the store, but it wasn't crowded by any means.  Of the six or so employees, at least four were standing at the counter with their backs turned to me preparing holiday shipments.  I stood there for about five or six minutes without being acknowledged.  When someone finally noticed I was there, he asked another employee to help me out.  That employee took about two more minutes to finish the package he had been working on before actually helping me with my purchase.  I was deciding between two cheeses and it really would have been nice to have been offered a taste.  As it stood, I didn't feel comfortable asking for one.  I would expect a store like this to be run by friendly people with a passion for what they do, people who want to spread that passion and convince others that it's worthwhile to be spending such ridiculous amounts on cheese.    In any case, you can stay for an hour or two after closing to prepare packages.  It's rude to stand with your back to customers.

I popped into Fromagination today to grab a jar of Yumbutter's newest concoction (WI cranberries + coconut = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=76RrdwElnTU in my mouth). Walking into Fromagination is like walking into the cave in the Goonies (anybody? anybody?) - you're surrounded by so many treasures your eyes dart around not knowing on what to settle first. The walls are packed with local treasures like Potter's crackers, Hawkwind mustards and relishes, Gail Ambrosius chocolates, and fridges full of Wisconsin-native beers. Nevermind the honey samples of which I shameless took about 8. I don't even eat cheese and this place is heavenly. My friend says sandwiches are to die for... I may need to work up to that.

8 oozing reasons you should get your hiny to Fromagination:  -cheese samples -located adorably on the square -friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff -cheese case with labels that describe the queso in Layman's Terms -accoutrements like raw honey, fig jam and truffle vinaigrette are loaded on the shelves (great spot to make a gift basket) -gorgeous atmosphere with French cheese signs and a long wooden table -grilled cheese of the month -and my favorite part: the left over bin with small hunks of great cheese for attractive prices
Great cheese and gift shop right across from the Capital.  Friendly and knowledgeable cheesemongers. Lots of local and foreign options to choose from. The only downside is the limited wine selection.

When we walked in my boyfriend said, "It smells like a rat cage in here." Although I'm sure he meant that in the sense that rats like cheese...there is definitely a funk. The scent of a good cheese, am I right? This store is pretty much a cheese snob's dream come try. Tons of local cheese and other cheese-related paraphernalia, vinegars, oils, etc. A great place to get a gift for anyone, because who doesn't love cheese?

Wisconsin cheese is amazing & this is one of the top cheese stores in Madison. I've never tried their sandwiches & don't plan to. It's their cheese that is absolutely incredible. It's better than anything I've ever had & I cannot find anything as good in NYC (for aged Wisconsin cheddar, I haven't found better). Yesterday, tried the Hook's 12 year Sharp Cheddar Cheese (a World Champion Cheese title winner according to the gold label). Oh yeah, this is true gourmet cheddar cheese! What makes it so special? Well, for one, it's slightly crunchy. This is due to calcium lactate crystals formed during the long aging process. And the texture is firm almost dry (not sticky or pasty). The flavor is super-intense. There's definitely something to this cheese! Keep in mind that aged cheeses contain high levels of tyramine - more info at http://www.headaches.org/2007/10/25/low-tyramine-diet-for-migraine/   Also, I'd probably never normally eat something called "Cow Pie" but I'm so glad I did. Carmel, pecans & fresh milk chocolate. Simple but OMG.  So fresh, delicious & absolutely decadent.

Fromagination is a lovely small business here in Madison. I recently ordered several cheese and charcuterie baskets as holiday client gifts, and working with the team at Fromagination was fantastic all around. Ken and Kate answered all of my questions promptly and politely, and they took extra care to hand write all the gift messages. They emailed me right away when the packages had been shipped and they even included a discount for my bulk purchase. I will definitely be shopping here again for homemade Wisconsin-themed gifts for friends and clients across the country.

This shop is a dream.  Visited again with a friend from San Antonio this weekend and fell in love with it all over again.  The variety of cheese available is incredible.  Several samples were available for the curious palate.  My buddy had questions and the staff was more than willing to address his questions regarding choices and even TSA cheese policies.  Last time we were here I stuck to the front of the shop. Realized this time that there is a huge selection of locally brewed and distilled goodies on display. Had we not been on a tight airport related schedule, we would have stayed much longer.

Fabulous, well curated shop with a terrific selection of both regional and global cheeses. A great selection of cheese related gifts, books, local chocolates and more. The staff was uniformly lovely, helpful and enthusiastic about the product. Sophie who helped us was not only enthused but but also one of the more knowledgeable cheese mongers we've had anywhere in the US. A very unique shop and worth a special trip.

Back again. Completed the Ironman 70.3 this past Sunday & made sure to visit here 2x. Was like a wide eyed child when I saw the Hooks 10 year cheddar. Asked for a sample. Almost passed out it was so good. Took 3 "orphan" pieces back to my room with some frackers & some chocolate of course.   This store is so incredible: service, design, variety of items & gifts & oh...the incredible cheeses!!! Love this place. Madison is lucky to have such a place.
LOVE this place!  Great assortments of so many delicious things, not just cheese--- and the staff is fantastic.  I want to stay here!

Great selection and friendly staff   Sometimes picking cheese can be overwhelming. You might know a few kinds you want while searching for something different can lead you to too many options to choose from. The cheese had handy labels with descriptions detailing the type of milk and how it tastes so you had a better idea of what things were before asking for help. One employee was nice enough to give us a sample plate to help us and another assisted in recommending toast that didn't take away from the cheese we wanted to present.  Bonus points for the alcohol selection, though I didn't check the prices

Everything in the store looks so pretty and precious. I popped in here to find birthday gifts for my foodie friend. Besides cheese, Fromagination also carries gourmet preserves, some wines, mustard, tea etc. It could be little overwhelming at first glance, especially the place looking so posh unlike most of Madison. But the staff are friendly, and willing to answer questions and help you select products.  After picking presents for my friend, I decided to pick few more stuff for myself. I knew I had to grab the handcrafted marshmallow when I saw it. The staff also recommended me a chamambert cheese called Fromager des Clarines  - which was so phenomenal. The creamiest delicious cheese ever. Now I'm hooked.

I have a deep love for cheese and this shop couldn't make me happier. Second visit to Madison and second visit to the shop. This time I made it my last visit of the trip so that I could bring home even more yummy cheeses. We also picked up some sandwiches and ate those on the road which I highly recommend.

The selection is pretty nice, although I don't think there need to be quite as many non-cheese items stuffed in the store. It felt a little cramped to me. As with many other cheese places, there are little ends and chunks available for a couple of bucks - a nice way to try something new EXCEPT that they tend to be dried out and/or ends/rindy, and aren't discounted! If cheese places marked these pieces down that'd be great, but I've never seen it done. Well, end of that rant. I was a little disappointed that the sandwiches are pre-made and the only eating options are outdoors (it sounds really nice to have a picnic like they offer, but I think that's not a great option for most of the year!).

This is a place that has some goodness for everyone. Do not go into this place if you are super hungry. I did and spent about $100 on charcuterie. (super delicious charcuterie though) They have sandwiches, lots of picnic foods, great stuff for boating food, snacks for Jazz at 5, concerts on the square, etc. Their sourcing is top notch and they give you samples!

Wisconsin is known for cheese, so it was a no-brainer to stop by and browse at Fromagination. Located right on the square downtown, they have cases and cases of cheese, including plenty of local Wisconsin cheese. I can't eat as much cheese as I used to due to my lactose intolerance, but it was still fun to look. What's also good is they don't just have cheese, but also sandwiches and salads and other snacks, so picking up a sandwich allowed me to try a little bit of the cheese without going overboard.  We got the chile ancho chicken sandwich, which had roasted chicken breast with a poblano pesto spread, salad greens, and Wisconsin provolone cheese, and sat outside the shop to eat. (They had a whole section of tables and chairs outside, very comfortable.) The bread was soft and soaked up all the flavors of the pesto, the chicken was great, and you could definitely taste the provolone, which was so good and tied it all together. Very glad we stopped by Fromagination.

I'm updating my review again based on the quick response and handling of the spoiled cheese situation by Ken (the owner) and his staff.   I sent them an email yesterday morning to bring the spoiled cheeses to their attention (simply to inform them that they had some spoiled cheeses on display and that they might want to double check the items they were selling) and received a response that afternoon. This morning I received a call from Ken who offered to either refund or replace the cheese that I had ordered, even though I had not requested either of these in my email to them.  This is great customer service, and eases any qualms I may have had about returning to the business!

Wow - the smell when you open the door - either you're going to love it, or you really won't. It smells like cheese shops should smell - STINKY!   Love - a wide selection, mini pieces near the register for low commitment sampling, a focus on local producers.  Don't Love - yep, they can be a little cold or snotty here. It definitely depends on the person as we've had great experiences here too.  So/so - they have macarons here, very hard to find. The owner said they are imported from France and shipped in frozen. They're not bad texture wise but surely not great.  All in all, it's worth a stop if you are a cheese lover. Saturdays are the worst day to visit as the shop is jammed with Farmers Market shoppers and therefore the staff can get a bit cranky.

Great shop for all of your cheese needs and more!  Love the selection and the cheese orphans - nice little snack! Staff is very helpful and will help you pick out companions and wine to go with your cheese.

Expensive with limited selection. I asked ifthey hadany cheddar other than Hooks.  I was told in a very snobbish tone that,  no, and"what is wrong with Hooks?" I 'd rather go to Brennan 's which has a much more extensive selection of cheeses. And fewer snobs.

Dear America's Dairyland,   I've been in Madison for nine months now harboring a secret I'm finally ready to spill. Brace yourself. I'm lactose intolerant. And even if I weren't and could eat all the cheese in the land, I wouldn't, because the texture, the flavor, the color... I find it mildly unappetizing and when I say mildly I mean mildly in the way that I mildly like to get punched in the stomach. Which is what it feels like when i eat cheese, so you understand my aversion, right?   Now aversion aside, I have to tell ya I find Fromagination absolutely delightful! And why? Because even when you ignore the cheese, the foundation of the business, it's still a stellar place! There's meat. There's jam. There's chocolate. And they're delicious! (There's more, but I feel like that should be enough to get you in the door.) Add to this an amazing and knowledgeable staff and you have the makings for an incredible specialty store. They put on some really neat events throughout the month and are an all around awesome place to lunch. I love... LOVE the interior; rustic, warm, and carefully curated.   So in conclusion Wisconsin, I'm sorry you had to find out this way, but dairy I say, I've still found wheys to make it work for me even choosing to leave out the lactose at Fromagination. (That means you can too.)    Yours,   CD

Fromagination. is. awesome.  I've only been two or three times in my visits to Madison, and believe me - it was more than enough time to fall heads over heels for this cheese shop.  The inside is completely covered in magnificent dark wood and glass, and is chock-full of cheese as far as the eye can see.  They have specials each month, offer free samples of really high quality cheese, and in general seem to offer local and foreign cheese options that have easily been the best cheeses I've ever tasted to date.  I don't know what more to say then to make a stop here if you get the chance!  It's in the heart of downtown and the quality of the cheeses sold is off the charts.  From 1-year aged cheese to 15-year aged cheese, they have it all!  And best of yet, they KNOW the cheeses really well.  In other words, not only do they sell it, but they're connoisseurs of it all at the same time.   If you don't know what to get, just ask and they'll help!  If I were to knock it for anything, maybe sometimes the staff is aloof, and some of the prices of the accompaniments are definitely overpriced (like the chocolates and crackers), but really if you're there for the cheese you won't be disappointed!  Even if you don't want to buy a huge chunk of some specific cheese, grab some of the inexpensive cheese orphans at the front counter, take a bite, and be sent to cheese heaven.

Wisconsin is the America's Dairyland.  In my view, no place showcases WI cheeses better than Fromagination.  This place is truly heaven when it comes to cheese from the state.  Here you'll find pretty much every offering from the usual suspects, such as Carr Valley, Hook's, and Upland, as well from other local smaller creameries.  If you pay them a visit right around now, you may even be lucky enough to get Hook's 15-year aged cheddar and/or Upland's Pleasant Ridge Extra Aged cheeses!  They also offer all the accompaniments, such as crackers, marmalades, and Gail Ambrosius chocolates!  Also, you can't leave this place without trying one of their sandwiches, particularly my favorite - the salami!  From what I remember, sandwiches run for around $7 or $8 a piece.  Overall, don't expect to penny pinch here.  Everything's on the higher end, thus the prices reflect it; however, if you're a big fan of great cheeses, you'll find the premium paid worth your while.

We were passing through Wisconsin and couldn't avoid stopping in for some cheese. Rachel was amazing! She let us try some great cheeses and really taught us a lot about the different kinds. The store looks nice and has at least 100 varieties of cheeses at various price points. All in all, we bought about 5 cheeses and some prociutto for the road. You must visit Fromagination of you're in the area.

Although they have a good selection of cheeses, the store and their employees are definitely NOT kid friendly.   A very bad experience 3 yrs ago with one of the owners was so bad that it caused us not to set foot in the store again.  If you have kids, save your aggravation and don't bother going into the store. Fragile & glass items are set very low on the shelves and easily accessible from a stroller.   The store is so tight that you will have a hard time keeping your stroller or kids away from the items. If there are other people in the store, you will have no choice but to move closer to the shelves which becomes too temping for kids no to want to touch something....  And if your kids do touch something, you may get a scolding from an owner by reminding you that  items on the shelves are fragile and can break. Seriously, anyone telling me that a glass bottle or jar can break is just being rude... we get it... duh,  glass can break!  Maybe if glass items were not 2 ft off the floor, it wouldn't be such a big deal.  Unfortunately our experience is not isolated. We have friends who experienced the same thing at Formagination.     So take this review into consideration - if you are with young children and are coming from the toy store just a few doors down, think again about walking into this store with them. You may just walk right back out and thinking to yourself, is this store really worth the hassle?  You may just find yourself going back to a local grocery store, co-op or cheese factory store for your cheese needs.

Before I even walked in, I knew I was in heaven. Cheese glorious cheese!  Fromagination has a great selection of cheeses that you won't find anywhere else (like the limited supply of cave-aged goat cheese with ash brought in that day from a local cheesemaker!). They'll let you taste any cheese before you buy and there are plenty of samples around the store. They have a nice selection of jams and crackers as well (they sell Potter's crackers, which are amazing).  Expect to spend a little more than you would on cheese from a grocery store, but it's totally worth it!

What a great little cheese shop. Selection and service were great. I'm surprised I'm not finding places like this all over Wisconsin.   Parking and location are both a bit lacking. It's worth the trip. Make sure you have meter money. Maybe they'll open a shop in Middleton.
Stumbled on to this cheese shop while walking around Madison. What a find! A true cheese shop with a great selection of local cheeses. Helpful staff. I purchased three cheeses.

This cheese store was delightful!  Conveniently located right next to my hotel, it was a great place to wander around at the epicurean delights.  I wanted to take everything home with me, and after careful consideration, adopted several of the 'cheese orphans' that hang out in front of the cash register as the small pieces leftover from the larger blocks of cheese.  They've got them sorted into 'Wisconsin' and 'non-Wisconsin' so that you can decide if you want to stick to locals or not.  It was a great choice for a little cheese tasting party of my very own, many, many miles away.  They've also got some mad-delicious looking sandwiches.
Nice little cheese shop with a variety of fine cheeses, knick-knacks from local artists and spirits.  Great stop for last minute tourist souvenirs. Staff was knowledgeable and welcoming.

Walking into Fromagination is realizing that heaven does exist, and it is in a small cheese shop.  Located on the capitol square in down-town Madison, Fromagination is a cannot-be-missed destination for cheese lovers.  They have a wide array of delicious cheeses from Wisconsin and around the world, and samples are always available.  Additionally, they sell other specialty food items such as chocolate, oils, crackers, specialty meats; everything you'd need for a summer picnic or cheese tasting party.    What I don't think most people know at first about this place is that they also have fresh made sandwiches available that utilize one of their decadent cheese selections.  On a nice spring or summer day, having one of their sandwiches on their outdoor patio makes for a satisfying lunch experience.

Fromagination is a magical place.  Sure, you could buy your cheeses at the grocery store, but grocery stores don't smell nearly as fantastic.  And no grocery store ever has as many samples, or as large an orphan selection.  I try to take out of town guests to Fromagination early in the visit to stock up on snacking cheeses.  Guests frequently insist on return visits, on which I am more than happy to oblige & accompany!  I find it hard to not buy at least one of the cheeses available for sampling (so good marketing, guys), as well as a few old standards (Oh, Hooks 12 year, I love you).  The orphan basket near the register is also awesome-- tiny cuttings of cheese to increase variety on your cheeseboard without leftovers!  Service is obviously a little more focused if you hit the shop when it isn't packed.  I haven't figured out a reliable pattern for this yet, but if you're patient when they are busy, the cheesemongers will eventually help you find a cheese or twelve you'll enjoy. If they're not busy, samples are encouraged, as well as a drink while browsing.  Fromagination also stocks a wide variety of "cheese companions", ranging from local crackers, meats and truffles, fancy jams & honeys, to Wisconsin craft beers.  I also tend to lust over the cheese serving accoutrements when I'm there, although my current strategy of cheese on cutting board with index card labels will satisfy my serving needs for now.

Fromag-i-whaaat? My sister, a Madison local, was telling me about one of her favorite shops along the square. I listened to her praise their service, selection, and overall cheesiness.  I was unaware such a place existed. But, I should have known better. After all, this IS Wisconsin we're talking about! Beer and cheese flow through the veins of most Wisconsites. And how can you blame them? Cheese is a wonderful thing. It takes careful crafting, loads of patience, and sometimes an artistic and creative vision.   She took me through this small, yet jam packed store on a weekday afternoon. The samples were plentiful, but the service was not. Understandably so, since it was during the summer and there were several concert-on-the-square folks milling about.   You could tell the people behind the counter were well versed in their fromage. And for the lucky few that received help, it was apparent that their knowledge was extensive.  Fromagination is a wonderful store that I could easily overspend in...if I ever got service....

CHEEESE!!! So much delicious cheese and so many toppings to eat it with and so many samples to taste before you buy. This is an impeccably designed and executed store. Service is friendly and accommodating of many questions. Everything tastes good. A bit pricey, though, so be warned.

awesome knowledgeable staff that makes you feel at home here. Tried many local and imported cheeses and chose some awesome cheese with  espresso rind. Even grabbed a rare and delicious New Glarus Raspberry Tart Bomber here.

This place is definitely worth a visit for cheese lovers!! They have variety of cheese that you won't probably find anywhere else. They also keep locally made fruit preserves and ciders...you must give them a try! Kristi was so helpful in suggesting us cheeses that we'd love based on our preference... And oh so patiently she would have us taste all of them we wanted and think and decide which one we wanted to go for... the best part is, they ship countrywide and I'm definitely ordering something soon!!

After exploring the farmers market last weekend, I decided to hop into Fromagination as I have seen it featured on Wisconsin Foodie, and whom doesn't love cheese and local made products?  The cheese that was sitting out to try was very good and I even bought a package of it along with a stick of salami. The store has a very good selection of cheeses and the workers I encountered were friendly and knowledgeable.   This will be my go to cheese shop.
Great cheeses and snack items.  Staff were wonderful!  This is a must for anyone visiting as well as locals looking for quality foods.
Love the little orphans. Great way to taste various cheese for cheap!

What a cool shop with such helpful workers!   I went in to get a specific cheese. There's so much cheese in the counters that I just asked for what I wanted instead of looking for it. I was the only one in the shop so I could have plenty of assistance.   They had the one cheese that I wanted and then since it was for a gift I asked the worker to select a couple other similar cheeses for me to add to the gift basket I was going to make. She picked out two more and let me choose how much I wanted. I ended up getting 1 lb. of one blue cheese and .5lbs of two other blue cheeses for about $40. They also gave me a $9 lunch bag to help me get them home unmelted and gave me an ice pack!   In addition to the cheese to go they have a small sandwich menu and sell other things that go with wine - serving and gift items. They also give free samples - both those set out on the counter and of anything in the cases you might want to try.   I liked that the workers either had to or did come around from behind the counter to get the cheese out. The counter cases open out into the store from the front. This is great in my opinion as it puts the staff next to you and the implication is just to be more helpful. If I lived here this is just the kind of shop I would love to frequent and become well known at.

I LOVE this place. It is a bit pricy, but they will let you taste basically anything you want and the cheese will never disappoint you. The staff are cheeses experts and always ready to help you select exactly what you want. I can never resist going in there when I walk by! Great for all types of cheeses especially exotic and interesting ones.

What a cute find!  All kinds of good cheeses from Wisconsin and other places. Bought a couple to take home for Christmas brunch. Store was cute and smelled good inside. Lots of different cheeses to try. Store was decorated well and lots of other trinkets for sale. Will definitely come back here to try other cheeses.

If they ever decided to rename this place my vote would be Cheese Paradise.    The vintage deli cases are filled to the absolute brim with fantastic wedges of some of the best cheese from Wisconsin and the world.  Round wheels of delight are stacked in every inch of space in this storefront on the Capitol Square.  And somewhere they happen to find space for gourmet oils and salts, chocolates and crackers and a small selection of higher end wines and spirits.  There are also samples, and lots of them.  Satori Cheese is one of my favorite WI makers and I was happy to taste their Pastorale Blend Sheep and Cow's milk cheese.  It was sweet , then cool and finished a bit smoky, largely because it's hand dusted with a robust Hungarian Paprika.  After snapping out of about 15 minutes of vacillating between sensory overload and pure cheese bliss, my senses were tempted by a large upcycled whiskey barrel full of cheese orphans.  If you're new to the concept an orphan is the little block of cheese that's left after most of the wheel has been sold.  It's too small to accurately depict the visual beauty of a wedge or a wheel.   So it's wrapped tightly in cheese paper, and marked as an orphan, or as they are known in my world - the perfect opportunity to create a small (or sometimes singular) tasting party!  And Fromagination has more orphans in more varieties than most stores.  On this particular visit I found a home for:  Pecarino Romano - Made in Tuscany,  Italy from 100% sheep"s milk, it's a very hard cheese that crumbles or shreds with a deep nutty flavor.  Red Rock Cheddar Blue Blend from Roelli Cheese Haus in Roelli, WI - It's a natural rind, sharp cheddar with a blue vein that's cave aged for 60 days and made with cow's milk for a creamy, mild cheddar flavor laced with a pop of blue.  Hook's Five Year Aged Cheddar -  This Mineral Point, WI cheese factory has been crafting some fantastic pure and blended cheeses for over 30 years,.   And if you haven't had their aged cheddars, you haven't lived.  The longer a cheddar is cave aged, the deeper and more complex the flavors.  A well aged 20 year cheddar can sell for over $50 per pound.  So this Five Year is a nice compromise with and extra sharp full flavor.  Beenleigh Sheep Milk Blue - I've always been a fan of sheep's milk cheese.  They tend to be creamier and hold deeper flavors than cow's or even goat's cheese.  This particular blue is from the Devon Region of England and melts on your palate to reveal a strong blue with subtle spicy undertones.  If you have a cheese list this is the place to go.  If you want to try new cheeses this is the place to go.  And if you've never had great cheese, this is the place to go.  Basically, if you like cheese, this is the place to go, and enjoy!

A really delightful shop featuring not only a great selection of cheese, but also tons of chocolates, jams, and gifts. The true highlight- the sandwiches! The Great Wisconsin sandwich is big enough for two people and absolutely delicious. The staff is really friendly too, offering me a Yerba mate tea right when I walked in.

I have to say, this place rocks! I love how far Madison has come since my days of high school. We wandered around the square to see what had developed since the days of yore, and found the hotel that is the site of a famous mothers day blow out (sorry ma, we gotta go back home, no time to stop by, oh, btw, happy mothers day...) and then saw....what is this? Heaven on earth. Sure 19 bucks for 3 oz of toffee is a bit much, but they had it out to sample, so I ate maybe 4 bucks worth. Then we got their grab and go section of pre made sandwiches.  Olive paste, some cheese and salami on a baguette!  With chips and gherkin and mustard and a bit of chocolate to compliment my meal. And a Capital Brew.   Gawd darn I could use one of these experts w/in walkin distance of my abode! (lunch for 2 was only 13 bucks).

Came to this place on my way back from a walk to the hotel. I love cheese, so I came in (thought the name was super cute).   Guess what they had? FREE SAMPLES! I'm a sucker for free samples, man. I tried almost everything. Fell in love with one particular:  Black Pepper BellaVitano from Sartori Cheese. GET THIS!  Finally I decided to order a sandwich. I ordered the fig and cheese sandwich. It was $7. OK, I don't mind paying more for good cheese. The manager, I think, rang me up. He swiped my card once, paper came out, he said he did it wrong. He swiped it again. Had me sign. I left.  A few months later, I balanced my checkbook (what? Like you're ontime with it?). They charged me twice.  I took the issue to Twitter and they responded! They said just to email ken@fromagination.com and let him know. Yeah, I did. It's three months later. No response.   I have taken it back to Twitter with...yep! No response. I'm not a happy customer. $14 for a freakin' sandwich. Ugh! Bitter much? Yes.  So, they get two stars. I should give one, but the cheese was free and good. I can't deny that. I want to, but that wouldn't be fair. Well, it wasn't all that free I guess. It cost me an extra $7. Bastards.

Great little shop. They go out of their way to feature cheese from Wisconsin, yet their selection is from all over. The quality of their layout and decor (they even have cable-controlled ceiling fans) is something you only see in Manhattan, not even Chicago. Outstanding customer service, unoutrageous prices, really excellent, top-notch goods. But not at all elitist. Also got a party tray from them and it was outstanding and beautifully prepared. Plus you can eat outside or in the shop in winter.

Lovely staff, welcomed us into the store offering wine or water along with a myriad of cheese samples. We savored the underground saucisson salami, a rich and rustic aged meat tube made locally. 2 cheeses called our names, the roelli/laclare jack blue, a meritage born of two separate cheese makers, and the bellavitano merlot washed cheese. We enjoyed all three outside on the capital square. The selection at fromagination was a fine collection of the outstanding local and international cheeses, meats, chocolates, oils and so much more. Great place to find a hostess or other gift, or lunch like we did. Cheeses were well cared for and rivalled any of our san francisco cheese haunts. Lucky madison locals, no wonder you're called cheese heads!

This is a fun cheese and sandwich shop! Their small outdoor seating area has a great view of the Capitol. They also have a lot of cheese/hosting knick-knacks for sale if you are looking for serving plates or cheese knives or little gifts etc.   We got there around 4PM on a Saturday - they close pretty early at 5PM so the Sandwich we got had already been made and packaged. Closer to close they do not make sandwiches to order. Our sandwich was still really tasty and we shared it. It had turkey and cranberry spread.   We split the sandwich on the patio, I tried a Wisconsin Craft Beer by One Barrel Brewing and then we went back in and bought the Speck Prosciutto (1/4 lb) and some delicious cheese. We took this back out to the patio and feasted some more. Expansive selection of cheeses here, though I don't think I saw anything super crazy (like the Alp Blossom! My new fav cheese). They did carry Red Rock which is a cheddar blue I have been seeing at farmer's markets/cheese shops in Chicago, so that was cool.

Sweet dreams are made of Cheese.  I am absolutely obsessed with this place.  You walk into a heaven.  Was visiting family and knew I had to stop by and get some delicious local cheeses.  Walked in and was welcomed with big smiles.  They handed us some hot cider to drink while we looked around.  5 stars alone for the knowledge of the workers.  The young guy behind the counter knew everything and anything there was to know about cheeses.  I felt like I was getting schooled in cheese 101.  He gave us loads of tastings and recommended pairings for us.  We ended buying 6: Red Rock -aged cheddar, Bleu Mont Dairy, cave aged chandoka -Cow & Goat Mix(award winning), GranQueso, pleasant ridge reserve - best of show, Little Boy Blue.  They are all beyond some of the best cheeses I have ever tasted in my life.  Note: They will cut whatever size you want so don't worry about that.  Not only do they sell cheese, they sell fruits, honey, nuts, dishes, and anything else you could possibly need for a perfect charcuterie platter.  I would never go to Wisconsin and not stop here.  I'll leave you with my one cheese joke:  What music does cheese listen to?         R & Brie........
Amazing selection of specialty WI cheeses. I got the WI cheese sampler plate, cow version. Perfect balance of cheese and accompaniments. Nice selection of beer available as well.

This shop is, hands down, the best cheese shop and gift store for all your foodie needs!  Just used their gift shipping service to send some cheese to a dear friend...they are so helpful.  Not only is this a killer retail store but their sandwiches are what dreams are made of.  If you're in town and want to experience and taste all of the great cheesy things Wisconsin has to offer...come here (on an empty stomach)!

This is an awesome shop right off the square in downtown Madison. The boutique area is filled with gifts ranging from cheese and meat board accompaniments, to books on mindfulness and gardening tools. The actual Cheesemonger are well-informed and friendly, always willing to give tastes! I wasn't able to eat here but would be interested in the raclette lunch.

I must be part rat because I LOVE me some cheese.  Grilled cheese, mac'n'cheese, grits with cheese, cheese sand, cheese on a burger, cheese fries, veggie chili and wit cheese, on a salad, with apples, with carrot slices, spinach and CHEESE dip, cream cheese, hard, soft or fumy cheese, on a taco, as a snack, on a charcuterie platter, cheese melted on top of veggies, did someone say fondue, omelet, stuffed bell pepper, casserole, shepherds pie, rito, eggs and cheese croissant, fried, died or laid to the side I am your girl.  That said I think you get the gest.  So when my sis-n-law said she wanted to take us to this cheese shop I was ON BOARD!  This place is located right around the Capitol so parking can be a premium at times.  Once parked we walked in and BAM I was hit was the WONDERFUL SMALL of cheese.  This shop is JAM PACKED with all things cheese and accoutrements that have to do with cheese.  Its a bit of a one stop shop and you can even get a sand made for lunch.  If that does not float your boat you can put together a little picnic because they sale everything from olives, mini pickles, fresh sliced meats, crackers, jams, chocolates etc., including all the knives to cut or spread the cheese and jams.    They also have cutting boards, decorative items, some bottled beers, wines and non-alcoholic drinks as well, and things of that nature, as well as, gift sets for people.  IT'S AMAZING!  I LOST MY MIND in this shop.   A HUGE VARIETY of cheese is GREAT and they will let you try a selection before buying.  We ended up getting a little of this and that to take back with us to the house.  Wisconsin cheeses as well as of country cheeses to delight your senses.  There is a high probability you WILL FIND SOMETHING you like.    Being one of the ONLY cheese shops in the area they get a lot of business.  This is a definite MUST STOP for cheese lovers or even if you just want a NICE FRESH sand for lunch.

Compare to Zingerman's in Ann Arbor - and these guys get blown away.  The markup is like 50-80% above what you can pay elsewhere. Bought a hunk of young Gouda and when we unwrapped it it was moldy and mostly rind - and we paid $50/lb and I see online other shops selling the same cheese for about $30.  I did not buy a Yahara Bay apple brandy for $80 which I later saw online for forty something.  They have nice stuff- but they seem to not be delivering the best value.

Mmmm, cheese! They have a pretty good variety of cheeses, but, I've seen a lot of the same cheeses at Woodman's, and for WAY less.  However, it is pretty cool to be able to sample the cheese before you buy it. They sell a lot of Dean & DeLuca stuff there, so that kinda gives you an idea of the prices. The employees are very helpful, and friendly.
